title: Instruments of Promoting Research Cooperation in South Eastern Europe
segmentation: Good afternoon ladies and gentlemen, I couldn't sleep in the evening today and I thought about how could I start with my presentation and I said OK, I will start with the.
Story from my personal life.
My name is Andre.
Cocaleros was already said.
I'm originally from Slovenia, but I've been working and living in Austria for about 7 years now.
And I came to Austria because I felt in love in a Croatian guy.
This creature guys started in Austria came back to Croatia, couldn't find appropriate job and decided to go back to Austria.
So I went with him.
And the message I want to put forward actually, especially for the creation participants.
Please take care of the brain drain of the Croatian guys because it has also consequences for Slovenia.
What I would like to talk about today is I will talk about the Corporation because I'm personally fascinated by this term because it's so much.
It's talked about cooperation so much.
We've heard that with this within this conference.
People are talking about cooperation on on the bilateral level, cooperation between the institutions, cooperation.
I don't know.
We have to cooperate in order to create critical masses, but what is actually the real cooperation?

I don't think it's a real cooperation for me.
It's a real cooperation.
If I do joint activity with a partner and this joint activity brings benefits to all partners and what is for me very important cooperation should be measurable.
So, um.

And especially showing you the instruments or the way how we did it.

Provide you some ideas what I mean, that is, let me say a precondition for a successful cooperation.
Your name research.
Is an Austrian applied research organization.
Carrying out research for both for private companies and for the public sector.

As you can see on this organizational chart, we're structured within six divisions, ranging from medical, technology, electronic and senders technology information technology to sustainability and materials, and well, of course also holding shares in companies and other competent centers.
I think it's interesting to know that your name research is not situated only in grads but also in other provinces or other parts of the Syrian province.

7 framework.

Programs were also a member of the European Space Agency of the Arthur and also a year network for young researchers and I'm really happy that Jarno Salonen is here today who will present the You network and in Spriggs me actually to my next point of our activities in Southeastern.

It's a status of our cooperation.
This was already mentioned yesterday by Doctor Bales.

I would like to go a little bit more into detail with conducted more than 100 projects with partners from Southeastern Europe and for your information, 70% of these projects were EU projects or projects funded from the European Union funds.
The topics are which are actually our water resources manager, management, energy research, climate change, nanotechnology and ICT.
Now I would like to explain you how we how we proceed, how we pursued our strategy.
Actually our first strategical partner was other Ljubljana.
It was important for us becausw they were here as a door opener as a facilitator of the Contacts with the important partners from this region and we are also participating actively participating.
Buy in.
These other calls when we are getting support for cooperation projects.
The second important partner is the Slovenian Science Institute in Vienna.
We use the venue there at the Corporation to present our cooperation activities in Vienna or our projects in Southeast Europe.
The next step was signing the cooperation agreement the first time with the user, Stephanie Institute and the second one with the Roudabush College Institute.
This was a let me say strategical framework for our future cooperation.
It was a kind of commitment on the management level.
Yes, we want to cooperate and here I would like to.
I would like to stress that when talking about cooperation, it's very important that all levels in one organization are committed to it.

More later on.

Yeah, I'm keen author.

Be cause if the people exchange if the people come to the two to another institution, they get to know each other.
They have time to build up a trust and I think it's an excellent tool for the beginning of of 1 Corporation and we're using this program's very actively.
You can see on the photo.

I think in this region the second program is VTC.

Premises for a successful Corporation in R&D.
I've already mentioned the cooperativeness at all here.
Here are her levels in the involved organizations that were important.
Of course, the benefits would be well defined for all partners.
What's the benefits for us access to new market or we would like only to exchange of not to exchange knowledge and also very important there should be no direct competition between the partners.
They should have different core competences and they should be active in different markets.
When it's when it comes to the project, work to the joint project work.
It's very important that the project goals and the project schedule and tasks are well defined.
Of course, clear and strict regulation when we're talking about intellectual property rights or, for example, the joint use of equipment.
And what I think is actually the most important thing is this personal relations between the researchers.
Building up trust.
Fairness opens to openness to foreign cultures and of course the willingness to travel.
Since we all know that face to face communication is.
The most important and this spring.
Me to my last slide.
And I was actually yesterday.
The presentation from Doctor Michalski.
She said it's the people that make a difference.
And that's what that's my message.
There are opportunities which are to be used, but the output depends on the energy.
Invested in Corporation and the people are.

Thank you very much for attention.
